method: Season the pork shoulder with the garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Place the pork shoulder in a roasting pan and cover with foil.
Bake for 3-4 hours, or until the pork is tender and easily shredded.
Remove the pork from the pan and let it rest for 10 minutes.
Using two forks, shred the pork.
In a large skillet, heat the barbecue sauce over medium heat.
Add the shredded pork to the skillet and stir to coat in the barbecue sauce.
Cook for a few minutes until the pork is heated through.
Split the slider buns and toast them in a toaster or under the broiler.
Assemble the sliders by placing a spoonful of coleslaw on the bottom half of each bun.
Top with a generous portion of the barbecue pork and cover with the top half of the bun.
Serve the pork-a-saurus sliders immediately and watch them disappear!
